text: hi everyone I'm Lindsay and today on
sweet talk and making tres leches cake
this cake with three milks is super
popular all over Latin America Mexico
and now the US and it happens to be one
of my personal favorites I'm starting
with my dry ingredients what I love
about this cake is it's a super simple
sheet cake so I'll start with one and a
half cups of all-purpose flour when I'm
measuring flour I kind of like to fluff
it up in the jar like this and then just
scrape it off with a knife to make sure
you're measuring correctly and then one
teaspoon of baking powder and 1/2
teaspoon of kosher salt if you're using
fine salt which I know a lot of people
have use a little bit less cuz it's more
potent than kosher so I'll just give
this a quick whisk now moving on to our
wet ingredients which are a little bit
different than a standard creaming
method cake so I'm starting with five
eggs there are a lot of eggs in this
cake and we whip them up kind of like a
meringue but since Aereo it's not quite
so I have five large eggs here room
temperature and 3/4 cup granulated sugar

get this whisking on medium high until

alright so in the last couple of seconds

this is called the egg foaming method so
